FestivalPlanner.GUI.AgendaGUI

Class ShowEditorGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • FestivalPlanner.GUI.AbstractGUI
      • FestivalPlanner.GUI.AgendaGUI.ShowEditorGUI

  • public class ShowEditorGUI
extends AbstractGUI
    Contains all elements and methods seen and used in the edit window of the GUI.

    Contains all the items needed for a Show and a item to enter these values. These are:

    • Starttime selector
    • Endtime selector
    • popularity slider
    • Name textField
    • Artist selector
    • podium selector

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGUI
        Runs initialisation methods and sets general stage settings, then runs the show() or showAndWait() method.

        These include, but are not limited to:

        • setScene(Scene value)
        • setTitle(String value)
        • setWidth(Double value)
        • setResizable(boolean value)
        • initModality(Modality value)
        Specified by:
        load in class AbstractGUI

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGUI
        Sets the values, alignment and spacing and children on initialisation. Finally, the method setups the main layout, rarely anything else than a GridPane.

        All the values that will be set here belong to one of the following:

        • Initialising Values (For example: Setting the items of a combobox to a list)
        • Alignment and Spacing
        • Tooltips
        • Adding the children (Setting contents of HBox-s etc.)
        • Adding it all together (Adding everything to a pane)
        Specified by:
        setup in class AbstractGUI

      • actionHandlingSetup

        public void actionHandlingSetup()
        Description copied from class: AbstractGUI
        Sets EventHandling of JavaFX Nodes. Mostly setOnActions for Buttons.
        Specified by:
        actionHandlingSetup in class AbstractGUI

      • loadPropertiesFromShow

        private void loadPropertiesFromShow()
        Executes all code you would normally find in a setup() method under the //Initialising values. comment.

        We do this to prevent other methods from getting too big, and ensure an efficient workflow.

        See Also:
        AbstractGUI.setup()

      • isAllowedToApply

        private boolean isAllowedToApply()
        Returns a boolean to check whether we set the current show's values to the ones in the GUI.

        It checks for empty TextFields and list selections. If any of these checks return false this method itself will return false and the configured values will not be applied.

        Returns:
        boolean to check whether we set the current show's values to the ones in the GUI

      • containsDuplicateArtist

        private boolean containsDuplicateArtist()
        Returns a boolean to check whether the selected artist(s) are already occupied.

        It checks if the selected artists are available at the given time. If one of the artists is not available this method will return false, open an error pop up and the current show settings will not be applied.

        Returns:
        boolean to check whether we set the current show's values to the ones in the GUI
